Scholarship.answer: Yes, the round-trip air ticket for TIGP-X doctoral students can only be subsidized once.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How to arrange the accommodation for TIGP-X doctoral students during their stay in Academia Sinica?
Scholarship.answer: During the research period of the selected TIGP-X doctoral students at Academia Sinica, Academia Sinica will arrange to live in the TIGP dormitory for the first year, and the expenses will be borne by the TIGP-X doctoral students themselves. From the second year onwards, researchers from the Academia Sinica who serve as co-advising professors will assist in renting houses outside the academy.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What kind of subsidies can researchers of Academia Sinica be selected for the program?
Scholarship.answer: Academia Sinica researchers of the selected program can apply to Academia Sinica to go abroad on business, and Academia Sinica will pay for an economy-class air ticket to and from Taiwan, and pay living expenses and office expenses (handling fees, insurance premiums) according to the "Overseas Travel Expense Reporting Points" . The air ticket money can only be used to participate in the selected TIGP-X doctoral student's thesis defense (Thesis Defense), or to visit the school of the TIGP-X doctoral student during the implementation period and discuss academic cooperation matters with their supervisors.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: After being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student, can I continue to receive the scholarship from my research institution during my research?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, after being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student, you can still continue to receive scholarships from your own research institution during your research at Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: The air ticket needs to be paid in advance, will it be refunded to our post office account later?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the air ticket for being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student needs to be paid in advance, and then after coming to Taiwan, the payment will be refunded to your post office account after going through the verification process of Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Do visa and transportation expenses need to be borne by ourselves, without subsidies?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, TIGP-X doctoral students need to bear the visa and transportation expenses themselves, and Academia Sinica does not provide subsidies. However, Academia Sinica will assist you in handling visa-related matters with foreign embassies, and will also provide transportation information from the airport to the dormitory.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: When conducting thesis research at Academia Sinica, we still need to be responsible for the tuition fees of overseas schools, right?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, even when you are doing thesis research at Academia Sinica, you still need to be responsible for the tuition fees of overseas schools.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How to submit the research progress report written every year to the bilateral advisors for approval?
Scholarship.answer: Each year you are required to write a research progress report, which is then submitted to your bilateral advisor for review. After passing the review, it will be handed over to the International Office for review by the Academic Advisory Council. After passing the review, you can get the scholarship for the next year.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Specifically, who is responsible for the guidance and assessment of TIGP-X doctoral students' research work at Academia Sinica?
Scholarship.answer: The assessment of TIGP-X doctoral student’s research work guidance in Academia Sinica is the responsibility of the applicant, that is, the student’s co-advising professor in Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: If TIGP-X doctoral students need to leave the country for more than a certain period of time, what will happen to the scholarship?
Scholarship.answer: If you need to leave the country for more than 2 weeks due to personal reasons, the suspension of scholarship days will be counted from the first day of departure, not two weeks after departure. So once you leave the country for more than 2 weeks, the scholarship will stop from the day you leave the country.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: When the results of my research at Academia Sinica involve intellectual property rights, what regulations do I need to abide by?
Scholarship.answer: When your achievements during your research at Academia Sinica involve intellectual property rights, you need to follow the "Academia Sinica Research and Development Achievements and Utilization Methods" to deal with them.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What should I do if I am involved in violation of academic ethics during my research?
Scholarship.answer: If you are involved in violations of academic ethics during the research period, it will be dealt with in accordance with the "Academia Sinica Ethics Committee Settings and Operation Points".

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Which foreign academic and research institutions can TIGP-X Pilot Program cooperate with?
Scholarship.answer: TIGP-X Pilot Program can cooperate with various foreign academic and research institutions, not limited to institutions that have signed an MOU with Academia Sinica. If the student's department needs to sign the MOU in response to this plan, the research institutes and centers where the researchers of the Academia Sinica belong can also sign the MOU. This program applies to the three academic areas of Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Which academic fields of Academia Sinica does this plan apply to?
Scholarship.answer: This plan is applicable to the three major academic fields of Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Does the TIGP-X Pilot Program have any restrictions on nationality?
Scholarship.answer: The TIGP-X Pilot Program basically has no restrictions on nationality. Doctoral students, whether native or foreign, can be nominated to apply. Taiwanese students who are studying in foreign universities' doctoral programs are also eligible. However, Hong Kong and Macao students need to leave the country once every six months, and cannot join the health insurance system, and their rights and interests are less than other foreign students. Students from mainland China will not be applicable until the "Regulations on the Permission for People from the Mainland Area to Enter the Taiwan Area" are revised. As for schools in mainland China, Hong Kong, and Macao, the Academia Sinica does not encourage them due to politically sensitive factors, but if the application is helpful to the joint research between the two parties, it can still be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Can students from Hong Kong and Macao participate in this program?
Scholarship.answer: Students from Hong Kong and Macao can participate in this plan, but they need to leave the country once every six months and cannot join the health insurance system. Compared with other foreign students, they have less rights and interests. In addition, when politically sensitive issues are involved, the Academia Sinica will conduct a review on a case-by-case basis.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Can students from Mainland China participate in the TIGP-X Pilot Program?
Scholarship.answer: Students from Mainland China are not currently eligible for the TIGP-X Pilot Program, and they need to wait for the "Regulations on Permitting People from the Mainland Area to Enter the Taiwan Area" to be relaxed and amended before they can apply.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Do applicants have to serve as co-advising professors?
Scholarship.answer: It is best for the applicant to serve as a co-supervising professor, but if some overseas universities/institutions cannot accept the co-supervising system due to strict regulations, the applicant can also strive to become a thesis committee member for doctoral students. This situation will be determined on a case-by-case basis, as long as it can be confirmed that there is a situation that promotes substantive cooperation between the two parties, it should be acceptable.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: If the applicant cannot serve as a co-advising professor, can he become a thesis committee member?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, if you cannot serve as a co-advising professor, you can try to become a thesis committee member. Individual cases will be considered during the review, as long as there are facts that promote substantive cooperation between the two parties, it should be acceptable.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Can applicants pay TIGP-X Ph.
Scholarship.answer: After asking the National Science Council, as long as the applicant has the fact that he actually supervises the doctoral students, he can use the award subsidy planned by the National Science Council to pay the doctoral students of TIGP-X, and the student status of the National Science Council award subsidy has no nationality limit.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What assistance will Academia Sinica provide after being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student?
Scholarship.answer:
First of all, Academia Sinica will contact the foreign embassy where the selected TIGP-X doctoral students are located, and ask them to help with visa-related matters. Then, relevant information such as TIGP dormitory reservation and room payment will be provided for the first year. From the second year, the accommodation will be assisted by the co-advisor of Academia Sinica (that is, the applicant of this program) to rent a house outside the hospital. Next, the traffic reference information from Taiwan airport to TIGP dormitory will be provided. After entering the country, we will also assist in the verification of the air ticket payment.

After TIGP-X doctoral students enter the country, the institute/center to which the co-advising professor of Academia Sinica belongs will provide the following assistance: 1. Assist in the application process of changing the residence visa to ARC, and remind to update ARC every year. 2. Assist in applying for accident insurance after entry. 3. After staying in Taiwan for more than 183 days, they will assist in applying for health insurance, Confucianism and related matters. 4. Apply for a post office account.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: How to arrange accommodation for the selected TIGP-X doctoral students during their research?
Scholarship.answer: During the research period of the selected doctoral students in the institute, Academia Sinica will arrange to live in the TIGP dormitory in the first year, and from the second year, the co-advisor of Academia Sinica (that is, the applicant of this program) will assist in renting a house outside the institute.

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: What reports and research results do I need to submit after being selected as a TIGP-X doctoral student?
Scholarship.answer:
Students selected as "TIGP-X Academia Sinica Scholarship International Doctoral Students" are required to write a research progress report every year during their stay in Academia Sinica, and after being approved by the bilateral advisors, submit it to the International Office for review to obtain the next year's scholarship. In addition, within two weeks before the completion of the TIGP-X cooperative research project and the return to the place of student status, a complete written research report needs to be submitted for reference by the International Office.

Students who are selected as "TIGP-X Academia Sinica International Doctoral Students" only need to submit a complete written research report within two weeks before returning to the place of student status after the completion of the TIGP-X cooperative research project, for reference by the International Office .

Scholarship.title: TIGP-X Pilot Program
Scholarship.question: Do selected TIGP-X doctoral students need to report to the hospital within a certain period of time?
Scholarship.answer: Selected TIGP-X doctoral students should report to the hospital within the starting date of starting research in the hospital.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: When was TIIP established and what is its purpose?
Scholarship.answer: TIIP was established to provide young foreign scholars with internship opportunities, let them know more about Academia Sinica's international graduate program, and then improve their willingness to study.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Is the application period from January 1st to February 28th every year?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the annual application period is from January 1 to February 28.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Can I apply for this summer internship program online?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, you can apply for this summer internship program through the online system. The application period is from January 1 to February 28 each year.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: When applying, you need to choose three advisors. Is it based on your own research interests and academic experience?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, when applying, you need to choose three advisors in the application system according to your research interests and academic experience.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: The internship period is fixed for 2 months, divided into three echelons, right?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the internship period is fixed as two months, divided into three echelons: the first echelon is from May 1st to June 30th, the second echelon is from June 1st to July 31st, and the third echelon is 7 August 1st to August 31st.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Who can apply for this summer internship program?
Scholarship.answer: Those who can apply for this summer internship program are current students of foreign nationality, including final-year undergraduate students, current students of postgraduate master’s programs, and students above the fourth grade of the five-year bachelor’s and master’s double degree system. In addition, Those with a bachelor's or master's degree may also apply. But please note that those who have already participated in the TIGP summer internship program and doctoral students are not eligible for application

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Can I juggle other jobs during my internship?
Scholarship.answer: You cannot take care of other work during the internship. You must devote yourself to the internship and abide by the relevant regulations of Academia Sinica. Failure to comply may result in termination of the internship program.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Will the internship program be terminated if it violates relevant regulations or Taiwan laws?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the internship program will be terminated if you violate the relevant regulations or Taiwan laws.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What documents do I need to submit when applying for an internship program?
Scholarship.answer: When applying online for the internship program, you need to complete or submit the following documents: resume, study plan, and two letters of recommendation (automatically sent to recommenders through the application system, and they need to complete the letter of recommendation before February 28) , Upload the official transcript with the school stamp, and the English test transcript (optional).

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: When will the review results of the International Graduate Studies Summer Internship Program be announced?
Scholarship.answer: The review results will be announced on the International Graduate Program Summer Internship Program website in early April.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: How will interns know if they are accepted?
Scholarship.answer: Interns can check the review results on the website of the International Graduate Program Summer Internship Program in early April, after which the admitted students will receive an official letter of admission from the International Graduate Program.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Once admitted, what are the steps to be completed in the registration process?
Scholarship.answer: There are three steps to complete the registration procedure after admission, the first is to report to the laboratory with the instructor, the second is to find the course assistant to report and submit the air ticket certificate, and the last is to go to the International Office to find the person in charge of the summer internship program check in.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What kind of air ticket proof do I need to submit?
Scholarship.answer: You need to submit proof of air ticket, usually your original boarding pass, original ticket purchase certificate (original), flight itinerary and passport photocopy, and you can hand it in to the course assistant you belong to when you register.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Who do we need to report and keep in touch with during the internship?
Scholarship.answer: During the internship, you need to go to the laboratory to report to the instructor, then to the program assistant to report and hand in the air ticket certification documents, and finally to the International Office to report to the person in charge of the summer internship program of the international postgraduate program. Stay in touch with faculty advisors, program assistants, and program directors.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: How much is the monthly living expenses?
Scholarship.answer: The monthly living expenses are NT$30,000 (before tax), of which NT$20,000 is paid by the International Office, and NT$10,000 is paid by the instructor.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: How is air ticket subsidy calculated?
Scholarship.answer: The airfare allowance is such that the airfare will only be refunded upon successful completion of the internship. (Please compare the prices of different websites before purchasing the air ticket.) If you will return to your country after the internship, the International Office will subsidize half of the cost of your round-trip economy class air ticket (up to NT$15,000). If you do not return to China for some reason after the internship, such as being officially admitted to the TIGP program, they will only subsidize your one-way economy class air ticket to Taiwan. To apply for airfare credit, you will need to submit your original proof of purchase (original), original boarding pass, flight itinerary and a copy of your passport. The refund amount of air ticket fee will be in accordance with the regulations of Academia Sinica.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What documents do I need to prepare to apply for air ticket subsidy?
Scholarship.answer: To apply for air ticket subsidy, you need to prepare four documents: original ticket purchase certificate (original), original boarding pass, flight itinerary and passport photocopy.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What is TIIP abbreviation?
Scholarship.answer: TIIP is the abbreviation of "Taiwan International Internship Program", which is the Taiwan International Internship Program.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: If I choose the advisor of Academia Sinica, will the International Office arrange accommodation?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, if you choose the advisor of Academia Sinica, the International Office will assist you in arranging accommodation.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: How much do you need to pay per month for a double room with bunk beds?
Scholarship.answer: A double room with bunk beds costs NT$4,000 per month.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: If I choose an advisor at a partner university, do I need to find accommodation myself?
Scholarship.answer: If you choose the instructor of the partner university, you can ask the instructor to help arrange accommodation during the internship.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Is travel insurance a must? How much does it cost?
Scholarship.answer: Yes. Travel insurance is required during your stay in Taiwan. Regardless of whether the intern has purchased travel insurance in his or her own country, the International Office will assist the intern to purchase basic travel insurance when they arrive in Taiwan. This is mandatory. Otherwise, interns will not be able to work in the laboratory, but the specific expenses will be borne by you.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Is this TIIP summer internship program for international graduate students?
Scholarship.answer: The purpose of TIIP is to provide young foreign scholars with internship opportunities and to enhance their understanding of Academia Sinica and Academia Sinica’s international graduate programs. We welcome interested foreign students to come to Academia Sinica for internships.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Are there specific formatting requirements for posters reporting on internship outcomes?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the International Office will provide a poster format for the interns to refer to during the internship. Interns are required to make posters and present the results of the internship in oral presentations. Poster presentations will be held at the end of June, July and August. In addition, interns should also remember to fill out the internship program questionnaire before the end of the internship.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What is the purpose of filling out the internship program questionnaire?
Scholarship.answer: The purpose of filling out the internship program questionnaire is to let the interns share their views on the internship experience, help the sponsor understand the internship results and collect suggestions for improvement.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Do I need to complete all the questionnaires and poster reports before the end of the internship?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, before the end of the internship, you have to complete the questionnaire, make a poster and give an oral report. Poster presentations will be held at the end of June, July and August.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: When is the Orientation for New Students for the Summer Internship Program held?
Scholarship.answer: Orientation sessions for new students will be held in early May, early June and early July.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Can I choose to take Chinese classes between June and July?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, the International Office will arrange a Chinese class for beginners in June and July. You can choose one of the months to attend, but remember to seek the consent of the instructor first.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Do I need to confirm with the instructor in advance for Chinese class?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, interns who want to participate in the Chinese class must first confirm with the instructor, and they can only participate after obtaining approval.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: What specific learning content does the elementary Chinese class have?
Scholarship.answer: The main purpose of the elementary Chinese class is to enable interns to increase their interest in Chinese learning and experience Chinese culture. So I will teach some basic Chinese conversation and introduce relevant cultural content.

Scholarship.title: International Graduate Studies Internship Program (TIIP)
Scholarship.question: Participating in the summer internship program will let me know more about the TIGP-X Pilot Program, right?
Scholarship.answer: Yes, to participate in the summer internship program, the International Office will arrange for you to attend the freshman briefing, so that you can learn more about Academia Sinica, the international graduate program and the TIGP-X Pilot Program.

plan application.question: How many types of Academia Sinica competitive academic research project funding?

plan application.title: application 2
plan application.question: How does Academia Sinica allocate funds according to different project types?
plan application.answer: When the Academia Sinica allocates funds, it will arrange according to the type of the project, whether it is individual or team integration, the scale and depth of the project, and benefit evaluation. They will rigorously plan allocations with reference to past experience and analytical reviews, while incorporating and revising results from relevant practical research for program review. In addition, they will also carry out follow-up management and assessment operations such as mid-term report review, implementation of expiry report evaluation, plan changes, and funding control. Each plan has a rolling adjustment mechanism for subsidy amounts to ensure optimal operation. benefit.

plan application.title: application 3
plan application.question: I want to apply for the first and second types of project funding, how do I start?
plan application.answer: If you want to apply for the first, second and third types of project funding, you can first go to this website to learn about the introduction, application method and schedule of each project: https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/index. html. When applying, log in to the Academia Sinica academic service management system at https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/. Then follow the system guidelines to apply.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Li Jiayin 02-27899476 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613

plan application.title: Review 1
plan application.question: How is the review job divided into three phases?
plan application.answer: The review operation is divided into three stages. Firstly, the experts in the project field conduct a written review, then enter the re-examination stage, and finally conduct a final review.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: Review 2
plan application.question: What are the main issues to be addressed in the review?
plan application.answer: The focus of the review is mainly to solve important key issues, the degree of innovation, the degree of expected impact and international competitiveness.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: review 3
plan application.question: How to evaluate the degree of innovation and international competitiveness?
plan application.answer: The evaluation of the degree of innovation and international competitiveness is mainly through the written review of experts in the project field, and then through three stages of review and final review. During this process, the review committee will conduct discussion and evaluation based on the performance of various projects and the similarity of themes, together with the views of Academia Sinica, to ensure the fairness and effectiveness of the evaluation.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: review 4
plan application.question: Under the new system, how are various research projects evaluated by the three academic committees?
plan application.answer: Under the new system, various research projects are discussed and evaluated by the review committees of the three academic groups of Mathematical Sciences, Life Sciences, and Humanities and Social Sciences, and decisions are made based on the views of Academia Sinica. This approach helps to fully consider the level of each application and the similarity of themes, making the funding more fair and effective.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: review 5
plan application.question: How does this review method ensure the fairness and effectiveness of grants?
plan application.answer: This review method mainly passes through three stages: written review, review and final review to ensure the fairness and effectiveness of financial subsidies. First, experts conduct a written review of the plan. Then, various projects in the same field will be submitted to the review committees of the three academic groups of mathematical sciences, life sciences, humanities and social sciences for evaluation. In the end, Academia Sinica will make decisions based on these scoring results and its own opinions. This approach allows the entire review process to more fully take into account the quality and topical similarity of each application, thereby ensuring that funding is more fair and effective.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: implement
plan application.question: How does the rolling grant amount mechanism for these research programs work?
plan application.answer: The rolling adjustment subsidy amount mechanism of these research projects is based on the progress and results of the projects, and continues to carry out follow-up evaluation operations such as mid-term report review, implementation expiration report evaluation, project changes, and funding control. After evaluation, the subsidy amount will be adjusted according to the actual situation of the project to achieve the best operational efficiency.

plan application.title: Foresight Plan 1
plan application.question: How can I participate in the Foresight Program?
plan application.answer: To participate in this program, you must first be a full-time assistant researcher, a non-permanent research fellow of Academia Sinica, or a newly recruited research assistant or non-permanent associate researcher at various research institutes and research centers of Academia Sinica. Next, apply during the period from March to May each year, submit the letter of intent in early April, and then ask the recommending unit to submit the paper plan information in early May. After that, it is time to wait for the written preliminary review, re-examination and final review process. In November, the applications that pass the review will be announced, and the plans that pass the review will be implemented in January of the following year. Remember to prepare a research proposal, a personal resume and a list of major works when applying, as well as letters of recommendation and relevant meeting minutes. For more information and how to apply, please visit the relevant website of Academia Sinica.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Foresight Project 2
plan application.question: What is the upper limit of funding for the Foresight Program?
plan application.answer: The upper limit of funding for this project is NT$5 million.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Foresight Project 3
plan application.question: When is the annual application period for the Foresight Program?
plan application.answer: The application period is from March to May each year, and a letter of intent needs to be submitted in early April.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Foresight Project 4
plan application.question: What are the documents for the Prospective Program application?
plan application.answer: The application materials include research proposal, personal resume and catalog of major works in recent years, as well as recommendation letters and office or center business meeting minutes.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Foresight Project 5
plan application.question: What website do I need to log in to apply for the Foresight Program?
plan application.answer: To apply for this program, you need to log in to the Academia Sinica Academic Service Management System at https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Foresight Project 6
plan application.question: How does the Foresight Program select young scholars with international competitiveness and development potential?
plan application.answer: The Foresight Program will set up a specific plan to allow young scholars to conduct forward-looking research topics with international competitiveness. This approach helps to select outstanding young scholars with potential for development and cultivate them to become the world's top academic talents.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Foresight Project 7
plan application.question: Where can I find out more about the Foresight Program?
plan application.answer: For more details about the program, please refer to this website: https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/cda.html.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Deep cultivation plan 1
plan application.question: What is the deep cultivation plan for?
plan application.answer: The Deep Cultivation Program is mainly to support and cultivate potential researchers of Academia Sinica, so that they can focus on original research on important topics. It is hoped that they will have world-class achievements in various fields, such as life sciences, mathematical sciences, humanities and social sciences. important contribution of the level.

plan application.title: Deep Cultivation Plan 2
plan application.question: How long will the deep cultivation plan take in total?
plan application.answer: This project will take a total of 5 years.

plan application.title: Deep Cultivation Plan 3
plan application.question: What are the application and review procedures for the Deep Cultivation Program of Academia Sinica?
plan application.answer: The application and review procedures for the Deep Cultivation Program of Academia Sinica are very strict. After application, recommendation and review, candidates can receive five years of research funding support.

plan application.title: Deep Cultivation Plan 4
plan application.question: What are the review steps in the application process of the Deep Cultivation Program?
plan application.answer: There are several review stages in the application process. First, domestic and foreign scholars and experts conduct a preliminary written review, then the committees of each academic group conduct re-examination, and finally there is a joint final review meeting of the three academic groups. Approved applications will be announced in November.

plan application.title: Deep Cultivation Plan 5
plan application.question: What is the upper limit of funding for the Deep Cultivation Program?
plan application.answer: The upper limit of funding for the Deep Cultivation Project is NT$5 million.

plan application.title: Deep Cultivation Plan 6
plan application.question: What qualifications do I need to apply for the Deep Cultivation Program?
plan application.answer: To apply for this program, the host must be a researcher above the full-time associate researcher of Academia Sinica.

plan application.title: Deep cultivation plan 7
plan application.question: When should I apply for the Deep Cultivation Program?
plan application.answer: You can apply for this program from March to May every year, submit a letter of intent in early April, and then submit a proposal in early May.

plan application.title: Deep cultivation plan 8
plan application.question: How do I apply for the Deep Cultivation Program?
plan application.answer: To apply for the Deep Cultivation Program, you must first ensure that you are a researcher above the full-time associate researcher of the Academia Sinica. Then, during the application period from March to May each year, the letter of intent is submitted at the beginning of April, and documents such as the research plan and personal resume are submitted at the beginning of May. Please refer to Academia Sinica’s Intensive Cultivation Program Operation Points for detailed application content. Plans that pass the review will be implemented in January of the following year, with an upper limit of NT$5 million. For more information, please refer to the relevant website or log in to the academic service management system of Academia Sinica to apply.

plan application.title: Deep Cultivation Plan 9
plan application.question: Where can I find detailed instructions and application forms for the Deep Cultivation Program?
plan application.answer: You can go to this website to see the details of the program: https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/iva.html. If you want to apply, remember to log in to the academic service management system of Academia Sinica, the website is: https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/.

plan application.title: Theme Research Project 1
plan application.question: What is the purpose of setting up the theme research plan?
plan application.answer: Thematic research projects are to promote the research projects of Academia Sinica and make important world-class contributions in the field of basic research.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Theme Research Project 2
plan application.question: What is the implementation period and type of thematic research plan?
plan application.answer: This project is three-year, divided into two types: individual research project and single integrated research project.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Theme Research Project 3
plan application.question: What are the application deadlines and procedures for thematic research projects?
plan application.answer: The application period is from March to May every year. The letter of intent is submitted in early April, and the plan is submitted in early May.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 4
plan application.question: What is the review process and announcement schedule for thematic research proposals?
plan application.answer: The review process is a written preliminary review by domestic and foreign scholars and experts, followed by re-examination by the committees of each academic group, and finally a joint final review meeting of the three academic groups. The results of the review are expected to be announced in November.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 5
plan application.question: How to select the most forward-looking and representative research topics for the theme research plan?
plan application.answer: The theme research plan will select forward-looking and representative research topics in the three major fields of mathematical sciences, life sciences, and humanities and social sciences. Their goal is to develop creative and ground-breaking research results to make world-class important contributions in the field of basic research.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 6
plan application.question: What is the upper limit of funding for individual research projects and single integrated research projects of thematic research projects?
plan application.answer: The upper limit of funding for an individual research project is NT$5 million, and the upper limit for a single integrated research project is NT$8 million.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Theme Research Project 7
plan application.question: What are the eligibility criteria for applying for Thematic Research Projects?
plan application.answer: The person who implements this project must be a full-time researcher of Academia Sinica.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 8
plan application.question: What documents do I need to submit when applying for a Thematic Research Program?
plan application.answer: The application materials include research proposal, personal resume and catalog of major works in recent years. .
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 9
plan application.question: What is the application system for thematic research projects?
plan application.answer: The program application system of Academia Sinica is the academic service management system https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 10
plan application.question: When will the approved theme research plan be implemented?
plan application.answer: Plans that pass the review are expected to begin implementation in January of the following year.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 11
plan application.question: How to inquire about the detailed description of the subject research plan?
plan application.answer: For details of the program, please refer to the website: https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/tp.html.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Program 1
plan application.question: What kind of challenges does the Critical Breakthrough Seed Program address?
plan application.answer: The Critical Breakthrough Seeds program is designed to address research challenges where concepts are still in their infancy but have originality and potential for development.

plan application.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Project 2
plan application.question: What important scientific and social problems does the Key Breakthrough Seed Project hope to solve in the future?
plan application.answer: The important scientific and social issues that these research projects hope to solve in the future include gene and cell therapy, data science, air pollution, quantum technology, future society, social investigation of totalitarian regimes, major diseases and precision medicine, agricultural biotechnology and health and longevity, etc. field challenges. These studies can not only help us overcome the current difficulties we are facing, but also allow us to fulfill the duties of the country's top research institutions and scientists.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Seed Project 3
plan application.question: What is the difference between the Critical Breakthrough Seed Program and the Critical Breakthrough Research Program?
plan application.answer: The main difference between the Critical Breakthrough Seed Program and the Critical Breakthrough Research Program is the program duration and research phase. The term of the seed project is 1 to 2 years, which is suitable for the research that is still in the embryonic stage of the concept, which has originality and development potential; while the period of the key breakthrough research project is 5 years, which is suitable for the research with a more specific concept and a relatively mature research program.

plan application.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Project 4
plan application.question: How do I apply for the Critical Breakthrough Program?
plan application.answer: To apply for the Key Breakthrough Program, you need to log in to the Academia Sinica Academic Service Management System https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/, and prepare the following documents within the application period: research proposal, personal resume and major works in recent years Table of contents. There are two tiers of application each year, the first tier application period is from January to March, and the second tier application period is from July to September. The application then goes through a three-stage review. The plans approved in the first tier will be implemented in July of the same year, and the plans approved in the second tier will be implemented in January of the following year. For details on the application, please refer to the "Academia Sinica Key Breakthrough Program Operation Key Points", and related information can be found at https://www.sinica.edu.tw/ch/articles/425.

plan application.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Project 5
plan application.question: Does the host of the application need to be a full-time researcher of Academia Sinica?
plan application.answer: Yes, the moderator must be a full-time researcher of Academia Sinica.

plan application.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Program 6
plan application.question: The application time is divided into two tiers each year. When are they?
plan application.answer: There are two tiers of application time each year, the first tier application period is from January to March, and the second tier application period is from July to September.

plan application.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Project 7
plan application.question: What documents do I need to submit when applying?
plan application.answer: When applying, you need to submit a research proposal, personal resume, and a list of major works in recent years.

plan application.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Program 8
plan application.question: On which system should I log in to apply for the Critical Breakthrough Seed Program?
plan application.answer: To log in and apply for this program, please visit https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/ of Academia Sinica’s academic service management system.

plan application.title: Critical Breakthrough Seed Project 9
plan application.question: If I want to know more details about the Critical Breakthrough Seed Program, where should I go?
plan application.answer: For more details about the program, please refer to https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/gcs.html.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Project 1
plan application.question: What is the goal of the key breakthrough research project?
plan application.answer: The goal of the Key Breakthrough Research Program is to enhance the basic research of Academia Sinica, encourage researchers to pay attention to social and academic challenges that need to be solved urgently, analyze existing limitations, find out the core of the problem, and propose a breakthrough solution strategy, and finally achieve To achieve the goal of world-class research.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Project 2
plan application.question: How does the key breakthrough research plan select key academic issues that are in line with Academia Sinica and the country's social development?
plan application.answer: The Key Breakthrough Program will carefully select key academic issues that are consistent with the development of Academia Sinica and the country and society. These issues are usually brave enough to challenge and break through existing bottlenecks, such as gene and cell therapy, data science, air pollution, quantum technology, etc. During the selection process, we hope to find research projects that have the potential to solve important scientific and social problems, and fulfill the duties of the country's top research institutions and scientists.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Project 3
plan application.question: What are the three sizes of critical breakthrough research projects?
plan application.answer: There are three types of key breakthrough projects, which are individual research projects, single-integrated research projects, and institute-centered problem-oriented team research projects.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Program 4
plan application.question: What are the homework points to be followed when applying for a key breakthrough research project?
plan application.answer: To apply for the Key Breakthrough Program, you need to follow the "Academia Sinica Key Breakthrough Program Operation Key Points". For details, please refer to the relevant website of the Academia Sinica.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Project 5
plan application.question: Who can serve as a host for a critical breakthrough research project?
plan application.answer: The full-time researchers of Academia Sinica can serve as the hosts of key breakthrough projects.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Program 6
plan application.question: When can you usually apply for the Critical Breakthrough Research Program?
plan application.answer: Generally, you can apply for the Key Breakthrough Program from March to May each year. A letter of intent must be submitted in early April, followed by a proposal in early May.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Program 7
plan application.question: What documents do I need to prepare to apply for the Key Breakthrough Research Program?
plan application.answer: To apply for the key breakthrough program, you need to prepare a research proposal, personal resume, and a catalog of major works in recent years.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Program 8
plan application.question: What is the funding cap for the Critical Breakthrough Research Program?
plan application.answer: The funding ceiling for the Key Breakthrough Research Program is NT$20 million.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Program 9
plan application.question: After the application for the key breakthrough research plan is approved, when will it start to be implemented?
plan application.answer: Critical breakthrough projects that pass the review will begin implementation in January of the following year.

plan application.title: Key Breakthrough Research Project 10
plan application.question: How to inquire about the detailed description and application process of the key breakthrough research project?
plan application.answer: To inquire about the detailed description and application process of the Key Breakthrough Program, you can check it on the official website at https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/gcp.html. If you want to apply for the program, you can also log in to the Academia Sinica academic service management system https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/.

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 1
plan application.question: What are the key sustainable issues to be solved in the sustainable scientific research plan, and what are the specific contents of the promotion direction?
plan application.answer: The key sustainable issues to be solved by this plan are the following six directions: 1. Energy and carbon reduction technology, 2. Food, air, water protection and safety, 3. Transformation towards a sustainable society, 4. Health Wellbeing and Environmental Change, 5. Earth System under Global Change, and 6. Disaster Prevention, Mitigation and Recovery. To promote sustainable scientific research, after reporting to the hospital for approval every year according to the recommendations of the Sustainable Advisory Committee, set the theme and detailed objectives of the annual plan solicitation (detailed annual solicitation instructions). The main research promotion is still based on the six major directions.

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 3
plan application.question: What types of solicitation are there for sustainable scientific research proposals?
plan application.answer: There are two main types of solicitation for this plan, namely: 1. Three-year integrated and single-integrated plan (the subject of solicitation is announced regularly every year). 2. Promote active planning (Top-down) plans from time to time (in principle, the implementation period is within 1 year).

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 4
plan application.question: Is the Sustainability Science Research Project Briefing Session held in late April every year?
plan application.answer: Yes, every year in late April, a project solicitation briefing will be held.

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 5
plan application.question: The deadline for applications for sustainable scientific research programs is the end of June every year, right?
plan application.answer: That's right, the deadline for program applications is late June each year (about the end of the month).

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 6
plan application.question: After the approval of the sustainable scientific research plan, it will usually be announced in November, and then it will be implemented in January of the following year?
plan application.answer: Yes, approved programs are usually announced in November and then implemented in January of the following year.

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 7
plan application.question: How to invite external scholars to join the research team of the sustainable science research project?
plan application.answer: To invite outsiders to join the research team, you can communicate with experts in fields related to the annual theme during the plan solicitation period, introduce the project content and goals to them, and ask them about their willingness to participate in joint research. If the conditions are suitable, they can be invited to join the team and jointly develop the project application. During the implementation of the plan, if you want to invite scholars outside the academy to join the research team, it will be regarded as a change in the plan and must be reported to Academia Sinica for approval.

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 8
plan application.question: What is the upper limit of funding for this integrated sustainable science research project?
plan application.answer: This integrated sustainable science project does not have a clear upper limit for funding applications, but the principle is that the total funding for the project should not exceed NT$20 million.

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 9
plan application.question: How to determine the reasonable implementation funds for sustainable scientific research projects?
plan application.answer: Reasonable implementation costs are determined by consensus at the review meeting. Appropriate funding will be approved at the review meeting based on the theme and scale of cooperation of each project. However, in principle, the total project funding should not exceed 20 million yuan.

plan application.title: Sustainable Science Research Project 10
plan application.question: Where can I find more detailed instructions on the overall promotion of the Sustainability Science Research Program?
plan application.answer: You can find more details about the overall promotion of the Sustainable Science Project at this website: http://www.cfss.sinica.edu.tw/.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 2
plan application.question: What are the six biomedical fields that the mission-oriented biotechnology research program mainly focuses on?
plan application.answer: This program mainly conducts research on six major biomedical fields: precision medicine/cancer treatment, infectious diseases, neurodegenerative diseases, metabolic diseases, innovative medical applications and innovative detection technologies.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 3
plan application.question: Which teams with specific R&D experience are the mission-oriented biotechnology research projects going to help?
plan application.answer: This mission-oriented biotechnology research project is mainly to help teams with experience in the development of small molecule drugs, antibody drugs, nucleic acid drugs, nano drugs, cell therapy and medical materials.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 4
plan application.question: How long is the ultimate goal of the mission-oriented biotechnology research project to turn the research results into commercially valuable product technologies?
plan application.answer: The ultimate goal of the project is to turn research results into commercially valuable product technologies within 3 to 5 years.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 5
plan application.question: Projects that have passed the review of the mission-oriented biotechnology research plan can be stationed in the National Biotechnology Research Park for implementation, so what support and resources will the park provide?
plan application.answer: The National Biotechnology Research Park has a variety of experimental spaces for the translation team to settle in, and assists the translation team to conduct value-added experiments through world-class core facilities. At the same time, combining the regular forums, educational training, speeches and other activities held by the Academy of National Biotechnology Research Park, as well as resources such as patents, competitors and market databases, can improve the business thinking and skills of the translation team and cultivate biotechnology and medical entrepreneurial talents. You can refer to the official website (https://nbrp.sinica.edu.tw/) for more detailed information.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 6
plan application.question: How many years is the implementation time principle of the mission-oriented biotechnology research project?
plan application.answer: The principle of execution time of this plan is 3-5 years.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 7
plan application.question: The principle of implementation time for task-oriented biotechnology research projects is 3-5 years, so how is the amount of funding determined according to the needs? Will there be a cap?
plan application.answer: The amount of funding for this project is determined according to the needs of each research team, that is to say, it will be arranged according to the research plan and budget proposed by the team.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 8
plan application.question: When is the annual application period for the Mission-Oriented Biotechnology Research Program?
plan application.answer: The application period is approximately between April and July each year.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 9
plan application.question: In which month is the deadline for submission of task-oriented biotechnology research proposals?
plan application.answer: The deadline for proposal submissions is mid-July.

plan application.title: Task-Oriented Biotechnology Research Project 10
plan application.question: The review process of the task-oriented biotechnology research project goes through several stages. In which month will the applications that pass the review be announced?
plan application.answer: The review process has gone through three stages: written preliminary review, committee review and joint final review meeting. Approved applications are usually announced in November.

plan application.title: Task-oriented Biotechnology Research Project 11
plan application.question: In what month does the approved plan of the task-oriented biotechnology research plan that has passed the review usually start to be implemented?
plan application.answer: Approved plans that pass the review will generally be implemented in January of the following year.

plan application.title: Epidemic Response Research Project 1
plan application.question: What should be done in response to the epidemic research plan?
plan application.answer: This epidemic response research plan is mainly to integrate the research capabilities of infectious diseases in the hospital, so that different units can cooperate in the research and development of detection technology, drugs, antibodies, vaccines and pathogenic mechanisms. It will also provide interdisciplinary laboratory support and use various related resources to establish a complete epidemiological research and development environment to enhance overall research capabilities. The plan hopes to establish a key technology platform and drug resource library for the prevention and treatment of infectious diseases. In the future, if faced with an outbreak of emerging infectious diseases, rapid screening reagents, antibody drugs, specific drugs and vaccines can be developed in the shortest possible time and quickly provided. Clinical trials and commercialization for industry. These research results will also be stored in the National Research Park, which serves as an important national resource bank for the prevention and control of emerging infectious diseases.

plan application.title: Epidemic Response Research Project 2
plan application.question: What kind of interdisciplinary laboratory support is involved in the research plan for responding to the epidemic?
plan application.answer: The interdisciplinary laboratory support provided by this project includes related resources such as molecular structure, antibody development, animal models and P3 laboratories.

plan application.title: Epidemic Response Research Project 3
plan application.question: How can research programs in response to epidemics shorten the time to develop rapid screening reagents, antibody drugs and vaccines?
plan application.answer: This plan gathers the infectious disease research capacity in the hospital and cooperates with various units to invest in the research and development of detection technology, drugs, antibodies, vaccines and pathogenic mechanisms. At the same time, it provides cross-field laboratory support and related resources, such as molecular structure, antibody research and development, animal models and P3 laboratories, etc., and is expected to accelerate the development of rapid screening reagent prototypes, antibody drugs and vaccines and other products. In this way, these products can be quickly provided to the industry for use in the event of an outbreak of an emerging infectious disease, shortening the development time.

plan application.title: Epidemic Response Research Program 4
plan application.question: When is the application deadline for the Epidemic Response Research Program?
plan application.answer: The time to apply for this program is from April to July each year, first submit the letter of intent in mid-May, and then submit the plan in mid-July.

plan application.title: Epidemic Response Research Project 5
plan application.question: What is the execution time and funding amount of the research plan in response to the epidemic?
plan application.answer: In principle, the implementation time of the plan is 4 years, and the maximum amount of funding per year is NT$20 million.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 1
plan application.question: Which unit of Academia Sinica is responsible for promoting the digital humanities research project?
plan application.answer: The Digital Humanities Research Program is promoted by the Digital Culture Center of Academia Sinica.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 2
plan application.question: What is the purpose of promoting the digital humanities research project? What are the core jobs?
plan application.answer: The Digital Humanities Research Initiative aims to assist in the digital turn of humanities research. The core tasks include building a digital humanities knowledge base, fostering innovative research in digital humanities, developing and using digital humanities research tools, and publishing academic works and displaying humanities research results in multiple ways.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 3
plan application.question: What is the planned process and direction of the Digital Humanities Research Project?
plan application.answer: Based on academic research, the Digital Culture Center integrates various digital cultural assets, continuously enriches digital content, improves the digital humanities research environment, guides the public to participate, and shares digital knowledge. Cross-domain integration and communication.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 4
plan application.question: Does the digital humanities research program interact with other related fields around the world?
plan application.answer: Yes, the Digital Culture Center not only participates in international seminars in the field of digital humanities every year, but also establishes different communication and cooperation modes with important relevant units around the world.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 5
plan application.question: For more details about the Digital Humanities Research Program, please refer to https://ascdc.sinica.edu.tw/.
plan application.answer: For more details about [Digital Humanities Research Program], you can directly refer to https://ascdc.sinica.edu.tw/.
